results.name: Irregular table read by rows: each row n (n>=1) lists the positions where the runs of bits change between 0's and 1's in the binary expansion of n, when scanning it from the least significant to the most significant end.
comment: As a sequence, seems to have a particular fractal structure, probably allowing additional formulas.
link: Antti Karttunen, The rows 1..1023 of the table, flattened
formula: Alternatively, if A227740(n) is 0, then a(n) = A227736(n), otherwise a(n) = a(n-1) + A227736(n). [Each row gives cumulative sums of the runlengths of binary representation of n]
example: The terms also give the partial sums of runlengths, when the binary expansion of n is scanned from the least significant to the most significant end.
program: (define (A227738 n) (A227188bi (A227737 n) (A227740 n))) ;; The Scheme-function for A227188bi has been given in A227188.
(definec (A227738 n) (if (zero? (A227740 n)) (A227736 n) (+ (A227738 (- n 1)) (A227736 n)))) ;; Alternative definition.
xref: Each row n (n>=1) contains the initial A005811(n) nonzero terms from the beginning of row n of A227188. A227192(n) gives the sum of terms on row n. A136480 gives the first column.
A318926 is a compressed version. If the order is reversed we get A101211 and A318927.
